questions: To what extent is LLM adoption guided by a clearly articulated strategic vision from senior leadership?
How consistently are LLM initiatives aligned with broader digital transformation objectives?
Is there an established process for sensing, evaluating, and responding to emerging LLM opportunities?
Does the bank have in-house expertise in LLM development, integration, and risk management?
Are training and reskilling programs in place to prepare staff for LLM-enabled workflows?
To what extent are cross functional teams empowered to innovate, validate, and scale LLM solutions?
How receptive is the organizational culture to adopting LLM-based systems?
Are structured management processes in place to support LLM integration across business units?
To what extent are employees actively engaged in LLM-related initiatives and transformation?
Are there defined roles and responsibilities for governing LLM use within the bank?
To what extent are model risks (e.g., biases) systematically assessed and mitigated?
How comprehensively are LLM activities documented, audited, and aligned with risk policies?
Is the bank systematically assessing LLM use cases against applicable regulatory requirements (e.g., GDPR)?
Are regulatory safeguards such as explainability and human oversight embedded in LLM systems?
How actively does the bank engage with regulators or industry bodies on LLM governance issues?
How effectively does the bank communicate the purpose, limitations, and safeguards of LLM usage to internal and external stakeholders?
Are mechanisms such as explainability, transparency, and user control consistently implemented?
To what extent are trust-related concerns (e.g., algorithm aversion, perceived autonomy) actively managed?
How rapidly can the bank scale or adapt LLM systems in response to competitive or technological shifts?
Are LLM investments and architectures aligned with evolving platform ecosystems and open banking trends?
To what extent are decisions about LLM exploration and exploitation guided by strategic foresight and market monitoring?
How consistently are data quality, integrity, and provenance assured across LLM use?
Are there formal processes for data access, anonymization, and data governance for LLM-relevant datasets?
To what extent are unstructured data assets (e.g., documents, chat logs) effectively leveraged for LLM use?
Is the existing LLM architecture modular, scalable, and compatible with secure LLM integration?
To what extent are LLMs integrated with core systems via standardized APIs and middleware?
Are architectural decisions guided by governance, performance, explainability, and resilience requirements?
Are there established continuous integration/continuous deployment pipelines and monitoring systems tailored for LLM deployment and updates?
How effectively are performance, safety, and compliance issues detected and addressed post-deployment?
Are prompts, data sources, and LLM behaviors versioned, audited, and continuously evaluated?
Are LLM systems protected against data leakage, adversarial attacks, and misuse across the lifecycle?
To what extent are privacy-preserving techniques (e.g., pseudonymization) adopted?
Is there a comprehensive security governance model covering LLM access, audit, and incident response?
